CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Central Station?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Central Station is arc {Skyline Station}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Harbor Point?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Harbor Point is arc {Skyline Station}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Grand Terminal} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {East Junction} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Skyline Station to Central Station in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Central Station to Skyline Station in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from East Junction to Grand Terminal in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Grand Terminal and Central Station in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Grand Terminal and Central Station is {95}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between East Junction and Grand Terminal in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between East Junction and Grand Terminal is {106}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Skyline Station?
SC.A: The total flow output from Skyline Station is {194}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Skyline Station?
SC.A: The total flow input by Skyline Station is {121}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 100? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {141} from {Grand Terminal} to {East Junction}, a flow of {106} from {East Junction} to {Grand Terminal}, a flow of {118} from {Skyline Station} to {East Junction}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 19? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {9} from {East Junction} to {Skyline Station}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 38 and 88? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {47} from {Skyline Station} to {Harbor Point}, a flow of {82} from {Harbor Point} to {Skyline Station}, a flow of {59} from {Grand Terminal} to {Central Station}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Harbor Point to Skyline Station or from Skyline Station to East Junction?
NC.A: The flow from {Skyline Station} to {East Junction} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Skyline Station to Harbor Point, from Skyline Station to Central Station, or from Harbor Point to Skyline Station?
NC.A: The flow from {Harbor Point} to {Skyline Station} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Harbor Point}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {East Junction} and {Grand Terminal}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc East Junction, Arc Grand Terminal, Arc Central Station, Arc Skyline Station, Arc Harbor Point}.
